Bool oprDynamicBridge ( optBusP  slave,
optBusP  master,
Addr  loAddrSlave,
Addr  hiAddrSlave,
Addr  loAddrMaster 
)

Create dynamic bridge between two buses.

Returns:
True if the bridge was created.
Parameters:
slave The initiating bus.
master The responding bus.
loAddrSlave The lowest address of the decoded region on the initiating bus.
hiAddrSlave The highest address of the decoded region on the initiating bus.
loAddrMaster The lowest address of the region where accesses are initiated on the responding bus.
Bool oprDynamicNativeMemory ( optBusP  bus,
Addr  loAddr,
Addr  hiAddr,
void *  nativeMemory,
optPriv  priv 
)

Map native memory onto a bus at run-time. The memory must be pre-allocated by the user.

Returns:
True if the mapping was accepted.
Parameters:
bus Bus on which the bridge receives an access.
loAddr The lowest address on the bus.
hiAddr The highest address on the bus.
nativeMemory The native memory to be mapped.
priv privilege for new mapping.
Bool oprDynamicUnbridge ( optBusP  slave,
Addr  loAddrMaster,
Addr  hiAddrMaster 
)

Remove dynamic bridge between two buses.

Returns:
True if the bridge was removed.
Parameters:
slave The initiating bus.
loAddrMaster The lowest address on the initiating bus.
hiAddrMaster The highest address on the initiating bus.

void oprModuleSetWallClockFactor ( optModuleP  module,
double  factor 
)

When running in wallclock mode (_wallClock specified), this gives the maximum multiple of real time at which the simulation should run. The default is 1.0, implying no faster than real time. An value of 2.0 implies no faster than twice real time; a value of 0.5 implies no faster than half.

Parameters:
module Parent module.
factor Wallclock factor to apply.

processor Processor instance.
instructions Number of instructions.
